relatedRecipes.name: Authentic Pho
relatedRecipes.description: Pho is a soup consisting of bone broth, rice noodles, thinly-sliced meat (in this recipe, it's beef), and fresh garnishes.

relatedRecipes.name: Gac Sticky Rice
relatedRecipes.description: With the fragrant plasticity of glutinous rice mixed with the greasy taste of Gac fruit and natural bright red color, Gac sticky rice is loved by most families.

relatedRecipes.name: Vietnamese Pickled Onion
relatedRecipes.description: Pickled Onion is a delicious Tet dish that is very popular because of its sweet and sour taste, delicious and crispy, which helps to prevent boredom with greasy, nutrient-rich, and indigestion-causing dishes such as banh chung, meat, fish, etc. This wild, idyllic place also appears on the daily rice tray because of its irresistible appeal.

directions.desc: Separate the egg whites and egg yolks into two separate bowls. Do not mix, because each egg yolk has a different use and preparation.
Use an electric mixer to beat the whites, then add sugar and honey and continue whisking until the egg whites are fluffy and fragrant.
Put the honey in the bowl containing the yolks and use an electric mixer to beat until the mixture is light yellow and has a characteristic aroma.
Put coffee with boiling water and pour into a cup. Depending on the taste and preferences of each person, you can add a little sugar or not.
Pour the beaten yolk into the cup of coffee you just brewed first, skim the egg white on top and you have completed the way to make egg coffee that is both delicious and nutritious.
The yolks and whites after whipping will be very light, so they will float on top of the coffee very nicely. Egg coffee must be enjoyed when the coffee is hot, stir the coffee below and enjoy.

information: Whipping an egg yolk into sweetened condensed milk will give you a meringue-like, silky, smooth fluff.
author: Richard Williams
seoTitle: How To Make Authentic Vietnamese Egg Coffee
name: Vietnamese Egg Coffee
seoDesc: Vietnamese Egg Coffee: Whipping an egg yolk into sweetened condensed milk will give you a meringue-like, silky, smooth fluff
description: Whipping an egg yolk into sweetened condensed milk will give you a meringue-like, silky, smooth fluff.
